title: Battery - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Make sure that the battery terminals do not touch the motorcycle frame.
This may cause a short circuit or spark which would ignite battery gases.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Fit the battery into the battery tray.
Locate the battery clamp to the battery tray and rotate until it positions into the recess of the battery.
The battery strap must be kept under tension during operation'
Failure to keep the battery strap tensioned will allow the battery to move.
Allowing the battery to move during operation could lead to damage to the battery and irreparable damage to the motorcycle.
Pass the battery strap over the battery strap support and locate to the hook on the battery clamp.
Apply a light coat of grease to the battery terminals to prevent corrosion.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first, tighten the battery terminal to
and cover the terminal with the protective cap.
Reconnect the battery, negative (black) lead and tighten the battery terminal to
Attach the fuse box to the side of the battery box.
